intro: Erythranthe arenicola, commonly known as the sandstone wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils, often found in coastal and inland deserts. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Erythranthe arenicola is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers.
